about.title: About Me
content: My journey began in Electronics and Communication Engineering, but I was quickly drawn into robotics and autonomous systems through the sheer joy of solving complex real-world problems. What started with basic embedded systems soon expanded into full-stack robotics software, simulation frameworks, and eventually autonomous vehicle development. Each step revealed new layers of complexity and possibility in the world of robotics.

Here's what drives me: I'm incredibly passionate about bridging the gap between simulation and reality. I'm constantly asking questions like 'How can we make robots more reliable and efficient?' and 'What's the best way to validate autonomous systems before deployment?' This relentless curiosity has led me to work on everything from low-level C++ systems to high-level perception algorithms.

My day-to-day work blends low-level systems programming (C++, ROS/ROS2, Yocto) with higher-level autonomy and perception (Gazebo/CARLA simulation, Autoware, YOLO, NVBlox/ZED pipelines), plus CI-driven SIL/HIL testing and cloud/dockerized deployment. I enjoy the full feedback loop ‚Äî designing behaviors and tools in simulation, bringing them to hardware, and iterating quickly from field data.

Whether it's developing a high-fidelity robot simulation or implementing path planning algorithms for autonomous vehicles, I believe the best robotic solutions emerge when technical excellence meets genuine curiosity about what's possible in the world of autonomy.
Ready to explore what we can build together in robotics and autonomy?

projects.title: Optimal Indoor Path Planning
projects.description: Engineered and steered an indoor robotic navigation project leveraging Nvidia's Isaac ROS dockers on Jetson Xavier NX, integrating Behavior Trees (BT) Navigator for efficient decision-making in food delivery from cafeteria to desk. Improved localization accuracy by integrating ORB Visual SLAM and optimized navigation speed by modifying A* heuristics based on dynamic obstacle detection from CCTVs.

projects.title: Japan Automotive AI Challenge
projects.description: Led a 3-member team to optimize Autoware's behavior path planner and implemented a custom RRT planner for obstacle avoidance in narrow paths for a driverless golf cart. Secured second position in the simulation round and participated in the finals held at the University of Tokyo.

projects.title: AWS Deepracer League
projects.description: Coordinated a 4-member team to achieve third position in the 'AWS Deepracer League - Nationals' leaderboard, skillfully applying various strategies in creating a Reinforcement Learning model for autonomous racing. Implemented advanced RL algorithms and optimization techniques for high-speed autonomous navigation.

projects.title: World Robotics Championship
projects.description: Led a 5-member team to achieve second place in the 'Micromouse - Mazesolver' competition by designing a self-navigating robot that utilized a modified left-wall follower algorithm on resource-constrained hardware like Arduino Mega, enabling efficient navigation and solving of intricate mazes.
